author: lamax6
title: Big Blue
review: Tow truck is awesome.  Loved towing all sorts of vehicles that had problems.  It made Exxon one of the busiest places in my Legoland.  Not sure why the blue helmet came with it, but I gave that to my Blue Knight in my 6075 Castle set.

author: hustla187
title: A Great Set
review: This is a timeless set because you get eveything you want and nothing you don't. You get two cars which are very cool and fun to play with. The minifig seems to be nice with the spetacular tow truck. This is sure to be a Lego Legend indeed.

author: chris38911
title: Random blue helmet??
review:
This is another USA-only set that I Bricklinked and built in the UK, I even managed to get a set of original instructions - and in good order - but I did cheat a bit and got reproduction stickers to avoid the costs of getting rare parts sent from across the pond......

Building Experience

Nothing complicated, a classic 80's vehicle build. The tow truck is very similar to the one in 6363 Auto Repair Shop and the car is very simple but well made. I am surprised we didn't see more of that style of car in 80's sets -  but it does use a lot of pieces in this build (the classic 4x7x2/3 vehicle base wasn't released until 7 years after this set). 

Parts

Straight out of the classic 80s parts bin - nothing special for the main build, although the headlight bricks, 2x blue bars and the larger tyres on the tow truck were brand-new parts when this set came out. Only rare parts are the Exxon-printed torso for the single minifig and the stickered parts - which are difficult to source outside the USA. Stickers on the blue doors and on the 2x2 white tile on the front of the car - I guess the white tile sticker was solely to make printing the door stickers worthwhile.....

And, why the blue helmet? No-one to wear it and no vehicle requiring a helmet in the set???

Playability

Excellent. Perfect for your Lego town at the time, and capable of towing pretty much all your town vehicles at the time.

Overall

I really like this simple set - nice build and great playability. But never available in the UK/Europe - Exxon isn't a recognisable brand on this side of the pond, and I guess Lego UK and Europe's relationship with Shell (at the time) would prevent it. It's a shame Lego didn't do a re-colourised or Shell version of this set, like the did with 554 Fuel Pumper (Exxon) & 671 Shell Petrol Tanker, or like 6696 Fuel Tanker (Exxon) & 6695 Tanker Truck (Shell)
